context_bundle.summary: Windows service audit and bloat elimination. Identifies telemetry, redundant services, and resource hogs. Includes safe-to-disable list and TCP localhost diagnostics.

onboarding.quick_start: Get-Service | Where-Object { $_.Status -eq 'Running' } | Measure-Object â†’ then categorize by third-party vs Microsoft vs bloat
common_patterns: # Safe to disable: DiagTrack, WSearch (if using Everything), SysMain, PhoneSvc, WpnUserService, OneSyncSvc, CDPUserSvc, InventorySvc, DoSvc, IpOverUsbSvc, whesvc
# Stop and disable: Stop-Service -Name 'ServiceName' -Force; Set-Service -Name 'ServiceName' -StartupType Disabled
# Check TCP localhost pollution: Get-NetTCPConnection -LocalAddress 127.0.0.1 | Group-Object State
known_errors: Some services resist stopping - will die on reboot if set to Disabled
IncrediBuild causes TCP localhost pollution with stuck Closing/FinWait2 connections
CSR Harmony Bluetooth = 7 processes bloat, safe to kill if using Windows native BT stack
